page.title: 08ARBORETUM-BRAISHFIELD
page.content: HILLIER ARBORETUM BRAISHFIELD. 115 acres of specimen trees which was started by the late Sir Harold Hillier in 1953. At first 10 acres were planted around Jermyns House, but when nursery operation moved away from an adjoining area in 1961 the Arboretum expanded yearly until it filled the present site in 1979. In1976 the Arboretum was made into a charitable trust to secure its long term development.Responsibility for the trust was accepted by Hampshire County Council in 1977. The Arboretum is open to the public at weekends and on Bank Holidays. There is also a garden centre which is open throughout the year.
